newsitem.title: DENMARK: Copenhagen bourse takes to internet from May 20.
newsitem.headline: Copenhagen bourse takes to internet from May 20.

text.p: The Copenhagen Stock Exchange said on Friday that it would launch a website carrying stock and bond data from May 20.

A bourse spokesman told Reuters that individual share prices and bond yields would be updated twice daily, at noon (1000 GMT) and the 1330 GMT close, while the KFX top-20 index and 10 and 30-year bond yields would update every 10 minutes.

The page, at www.xcse.dk, will also give data on other indices, unit trusts, futures and options and general information about the exchange and its markets. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969650
